prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat base and a flat top. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. First, create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.256, 0.0] Next, generate a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system with the following steps: 1. Draw a rectangle, where the first line segment of the rectangle has a Start Point at [0.0, 0.0] and End Point at [0.6181, 0.0]. 2. Draw the second line segment of the rectangle, starting from the first segment's endpoint [0.6181, 0.0] and going to [0.6181, 0.75]. 3. Draw the third line segment of the rectangle, starting from the second segment's endpoint [0.6181, 0.75] and going to [0.0, 0.75]. 4. Draw the fourth line segment of the rectangle, starting from the third segment's endpoint [0.0, 0.75] and going to the Start Point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the following parameters: - Euler Angles from the defined coordinate system: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector from coordinate system: [0.0, 0.256, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D prism: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.256 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0 The resulting prism should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.256 - Height: 0.75 With these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to generate the desired intermediate CAD part, without any additional assumptions.</description>
